meanings.definition: A line used for saving or preserving life, especially in emergencies.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the sailor clung to the lifelines to stay safe.
meanings.sent2: The lifelines on the ship helped rescue the crew members in danger.
meanings.sent3: The lifelines on the boat were like superheroes, always ready to save the day.
meanings.sent4: In times of trouble, friends can be our lifelines, pulling us to safety.
meanings.sent5: The lifelines on the mountain were the only hope for the stranded climbers.

meanings.definition: A source of support or assistance that is crucial for survival.
meanings.sent1: Family can be our lifelines, providing love and help when we need it most.
meanings.sent2: In a difficult situation, having a lifeline to call can make all the difference.
meanings.sent3: The lifelines of friendship kept them strong through thick and thin.
meanings.sent4: Hope can be a lifeline in dark times, guiding us towards a brighter future.
meanings.sent5: The lifelines of the community came together to help those in need after the disaster.
